727710f-a.title: Queens: Queens Boulevard - Greenpoint Avenue
727710f-a.text:
Queens Boulevard (in center thereof), just east of Greenpoint
Ave. Thie property was just east of an old hotel operated by Eugh
O'Reilly which in 1891 was located at the intersection of Thompson
Ave. (now Queens Boulevard) and Greenpoint Ave. The group of
buildings which may have belonged to Mrs. Cameron in 1873 were de-
molished in March 1925. In the left background is an elevated line
known as the Flushing Elevated Lines and is operated by the Manhattan
and Queens County Railway Company.
March 1923.
Eugene L. Armbruster Collection.
MAY BE REPRODUCED.
